Setting up Freshservice.title: How to access audit log in Freshservice?
Setting up Freshservice.description:
Audit log maintains a list of all changes made under the Admin section of your service desk. Use Audit log to identify the trail of changes for reference during audits or service desk incidents. Events related to individual ITIL modules, such as Tickets, Problems, Change, etc., are tracked under Activities.


TABLE OF CONTENTS
  • Accessing Audit Log
  • Applying filters
  • Frequently Asked Questions 


The Audit log keeps track of changes made to the following modules: 

  • Accounts 
  • Plans and billings
  • Agents
  • Requesters/Contacts
  • Agent Groups
  • Change (Change Lifecycle & Change Form Fields)
  • Sandbox
  • SLA Policies
  • Vendor Fields
  • Assume Identity
  • Credentials
  • Department and department fields
  • Orchestration Apps inside workflows 
  • Scenario Automation
  • Roles


The assumed identity action performed by the user will also be captured under the "Activities" section for tickets and changes.


Accessing Audit Log

Here's how you can access the audit log:

  1. Go to Admin > Account Settings > Audit Log. If your account has multiple workspaces, go to Admin Settings > Workspace Settings > {Workspace Name} > Account Settings > Audit Log. Learn more about multiple workspaces.


Audit log captures the following details for every entry:

  • Time: Date and Time when the change was made
  • What changed?: The module where the change was made
  • Action: The type of action that was made—Created/Updated
  • Performed by: The user who made the change
  • Details: Fields that were changed and the field values that were added or updated


Applying filters

Filter the audit log entries to narrow down to the incident of your interest. Use date ranges, object types (Account, Plan & Billing, Group and Agent), or the user to filter the entries. 


To apply filters, 


  1. Click the funnel icon in the top right corner. 

  2. Choose the date range for which you wish to view the audit log. 

  3. Select the user under the "Performed by" category to narrow down the search to a specific agent. 


  4. Choose the Object type from What's changed? (Accounts, Plans & billing, Agents, Requesters/Contacts, Agent Groups, Changes, Sandbox, SLA policy, and Assume identity)

  5. Once done, click Apply.


Frequently Asked Questions 


  1. Is it possible to find who has created or removed an account in Freshservice?
    If your account is in Enterprise plan you can navigate to the Admin --> Audit logs, and on the respective time frame you will be able to view who has performed the action along with the IP address.

  2. Why am I unable to view/find audit logs?
    Currently, audit logs are only available to enterprise customers, and only admins have access to them.

    You can also GET audit logs through API. Please refer to - Service Desk API for Developers | Freshservice 

  3. Where do I go to see user login, profile creation and  activity logs?
    In Audit Logs, Organization Admins can get a comprehensive report of all user and profile change activity. Some of the activities captured at the Organisation level are user login, User created, User deleted, User upgraded, 2FA disabled/enabled and Security settings updated.

  4. What changes to an account are captured in Audit logs?
    The changes to account's primary contact such as first name, last name, email, phone, along with changes to account name, invoice email, domain and account mode are captured in audit logs.

Setting up Freshservice.title: Configure Multilingual Forms
Setting up Freshservice.description:
Note: Custom field translation will be available for the Problem, Release, and Change modules from August 2024.

Now admins can translate custom fields for all the languages configured in their service desk portal. 

All fields and dropdown choices will be translated based on a logged-in requester’s language preference. Similar way, agents can also see all fields and dropdown choices translated based on their preferred language in Profile Settings.


How to manage translations for fields?

  • Navigate to Admin -> Service Desk Rebranding in Account Settings.
    If your account has more than one workspace:
    To modify global workflows, navigate to Admin > Global Settings > Account Settings > Service Desk Rebranding.
    To modify workspace-level workflows, navigate to Admin > Workspace Settings > {Workspace Name} > Account Settings > Service Desk Rebranding.

  • In Languages, click the Manage Languages button.



  • Once the primary language is set, add the languages (for eg. French) you wish to translate under Supported Languages and click Save.

  • Click the Download Translation file from the primary language.


  • Using a text editor, add all translations for custom fields in the downloaded file. 

  • Then, hover over any of the language choices and click the edit icon.

  • Once you’ve added the custom fields for the supported language (French), upload the translated .yml file and click Upload.

  • In case, you wish to delete a supported language, hover over the language choice and click the delete icon.


How to update/ delete translations for a language?

  • Under supported languages, hover over any of the language choices, click the edit icon.

  • Click Download to get the latest translated file, update the translations for the new fields using the text editor.

  • Click on Upload New, add the new .yml file and click Upload. This will overwrite the current version of the translation.

  • Click on Delete translation to delete an existing translation file.



Heads up!

  • Admins can translate custom fields in their preferred language for Problem, Release, and Change modules, in addition to ticket and time sheet forms.

  • When a new field is added to the form, users will also have to manually update the translation file in Manage Languages to ensure the following field is translated into their preferred language.

Setting up Freshservice.title: Using Rank order in Freshservice Analytics
Setting up Freshservice.description:
One of the features of Freshservice Analytics is the Rank Order option, which allows you to rank your data based on a specific metric. 

Here's how to use the Rank Order option to create a report of your top 10 ticket submitters.


  1. Go to Analytics, and select the Tickets dataset.
  2. Group your data by requester name by dragging the Requester Name field to the Rows section.
  3. Click on Add Metric and select the Total Tickets metric. This will show you the total number of tickets submitted by each requester.
  4. Click on the Rank Order option in the Total Tickets column and select Top 10. This will rank your data based on the total number of tickets submitted and show you the top 10 submitters.
  5. You can customize your report by adding metrics or filters to your data.



Using the Rank Order option in Freshservice Analytics is a great way to identify your top performers or areas needing improvement quickly. By following these simple steps, you can create a report of your top 10 ticket submitters and gain valuable insights into your support operations.

Managing Notifications.title: Schedule and Post Announcements in Freshservice
Managing Notifications.description:
Freshservice lets you post announcements to share updates with agents and end-users. This is particularly helpful for bringing teams up to speed with new releases and posting downtime alerts. You can schedule announcements to be published at a specific date and time if you like. If the announcement is relevant only for a fixed period, you can also specify when it should be removed. Besides, you can even email critical announcements to agents, users, and third-party vendors.

To schedule and post announcements:

  1. Click Announcements on the top-right of your Dashboard. A slide-in window will appear on the right.
  2. Click New Announcement. 
  3. Enter a Title and Description for the announcement.
  4. Specify a Start Date and Time for the announcement's publication. 
  5. Specify an End Date and Time for when the announcement display needs to be stopped showing. 


You can choose to make the announcement visible just to the people it is relevant to- everyone, all agents or specific agents and groups/departments. Leave the box checked to notify them by email.


There may be vendors etc. that might not be added in Freshservice as agents or requesters, but still need to be updated about the announcement. You can add them as email recipients to notify them when the announcement goes live.


The announcement becomes active on the scheduled date and time. Agents can view all active and scheduled announcements on the Freshservice dashboard. They can browse through them using the previous/next arrows, or view a list of all announcements and filter them by their current status.



Note: Requesters can only see active announcements on the self-service portal.


Faq:


1. What permission do I need to be able to create new announcements?


The following permissions need to be checked to access announcements.

Managing Notifications.title: Notification Center
Managing Notifications.description:
Notifying users at the right time can improve response and resolution times. In addition to receiving updates on Freshservice activities through emails, agents and requesters can now choose to receive in-browser and desktop notifications through the Notification Center for certain events such as approval requests and ticket updates. The Notification Center can be accessed by clicking on the bell icon at the top right corner of the screen, and displays events that occurred in the last 30 days.




Types of Events

Notifications can be enabled or disabled for different types of events by navigating to Notification Center (bell icon) > Settings and toggling the corresponding event types to ON or OFF.



The event types that are available for agents and requesters are:


Agents


Event Type

Description

Service Request sent for my approval

Agents who have been added as approvers on a service request will receive this notification. Clicking on it will redirect the agent to the approval page for the service request.

Approval decision on service request

Agents to whom a service request is assigned will be informed when its approval or rejection happens.

Change sent for my approval

Agents who are members of Change Advisory Boards and have been added as a approver on a change will receive this notification. Clicking on it will redirect the agent to the approval page for the change.

Approval decision on change

Agents to whom a change is assigned will be informed when its approval or rejection happens.

Contract sent for my approval

Agents who have been added as approvers on a contract will receive this notification. Clicking on it will redirect the agent to the contract and allow them to approve or reject it.

Approval decision on contract

Agents who create and submit a contract for approval will be informed when its approval or rejection happens.

New ticket created

Agents who are marked as requesters on a ticket will be notified when such tickets are created. In addition to this, agents who are explicitly added under the “Notify Agents” section in the New Ticket Created email notification will be informed each time a new ticket is created in the system.

Requester responds to ticket

Agents to whom tickets are assigned, or are added as watchers to a ticket, will be notified each time the requester responds to the ticket.
Public note added to ticket

Agents to whom tickets are assigned, or are added as watchers to a ticket, will be notified each time someone adds a public note to the ticket.
Private note added to ticket

Agents to whom tickets are assigned, or are added as watchers to a ticket, will be notified each time someone adds a private note to the ticket.

Status updated on ticket

Agents to whom tickets are assigned, or are added as watchers to a ticket, will be notified when a ticket is marked as resolved or closed.

Ticket assigned to my group

Agents who are members of a group will be notified if a ticket is assigned to the group.

Ticket assigned to me

Agents will be notified if a ticket is assigned to them.


Requesters


Event Type

Description

Service Request sent for my approval

Requesters who have been added as approvers on a service request will receive this notification. Clicking on it will redirect the requester to the approval page for the service request.

Change sent for my approval

Requesters who are members of Change Advisory Boards and have been added as a approver on a change will receive this notification. Clicking on it will redirect the requester to the approval page for the change.

New ticket created

Requesters who create tickets, or those who are marked as requesters on a ticket will be notified when such tickets are created.

New response to ticket

Requesters who create tickets for themselves, and users who are marked as requesters on a ticket will be notified when an agent replies, or a public note is added to the ticket.

Status updated on ticket

Requesters who create tickets, or those who are marked as requesters on a ticket will be notified when a ticket is marked as resolved or closed.


Sounds

The in-browser notifications within Freshservice can be accompanied by a sound. These sounds can be turned ON or OFF by navigating to Notification Center (bell icon) > Settings and toggling the speaker icon to the ON or OFF state.


Desktop Notifications

If notifications for a particular event type have been enabled, then Freshservice can alert you of these events through push notifications in your operating system in addition to in-browser notifications. These OS-based push notifications can alert you even if you’re working in a different browser tab, or have minimized the browser window.


Enabling Desktop Notifications

Desktop notifications can be enabled by navigating to Notification Center (bell icon) > Settings, and clicking on "Enable" against "Desktop notifications have not been enabled".


Blocking/Re-enabling Desktop Notifications

Blocking or re-enabling desktop notifications requires the web browser settings to be modified. Instructions for commonly used web browsers are available below:

  • Google Chrome: https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/3220216
  • Mozilla Firefox: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/push-notifications-firefox
  • Apple Safari: https://support.apple.com/en-in/guide/safari/manage-website-notifications-sfri40734

Critical product announcements.description:
Due to a recent update by Letsencrypt, their root certificate Identrust-DST-Root-CA-x3 will not be valid from 30th September 2021. If you are using a custom domain for your accounts, your users on older OS/browser versions might face connection issues.

  2. Update your OS/Browser versions if you are impacted: You will see a "Connection Not Secured" error caused by the Let'sEncrypt root certificate "Identrust-DST-Root-CA-x3" expiry if you do not update your browsers / OS.

Procedure to Add ISRG X1 root certificate:


  • If you face the "Your connection is not private" error while accessing the portals, here is what you have to do.

     


  • Visit the Let's encrypt home site and download the ACTIVE version of the ISRG Root X1 Certificate. (Pem format)
